title: Ribafreixo 2015 Pato Frio Grand Escolha Antão Vaz (Alentejano)
description: This is a young wood-aged wine with rich toast. While the toast does smother the fruit at the moment, there are enough crisp acidity and citrus flavors in the background to come through as the wine matures for another year or two. Drink from 2018.

title: Ribbon Cliff 2013 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Barrel notes dominate, with aromas of vanilla, pencil lead and coconut shavings out in front of purple fruit that's struggling to get to the surface. The palate is tart and elegantly styled, but the wood takes over the show.

title: Montes 2015 Limited Selection Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère (Colchagua Costa)
description: Rubbery black-fruit aromas are heavily oaked, so much so that this Cabernet-Carmenère blend smells charred but also like plastic. A big grabby palate is jagged in feel, while this tastes like the nose suggests, meaning oaky, herbal and like berry fruits and plum. A woody finish is short on total integration.

title: Montes 2015 Limited Selection Pinot Noir (Aconcagua Costa)
description: Dusty raspberry and plum aromas show a note of Band-Aid. This feels creamy and full, with black cherry, chocolate and oak flavors. An oaky essence carries onto the finish, which is chunky and lasting.

title: Poças 2015 Coroa d'Ouro Red (Douro)
description: This is a warm ripe wine. Its generous texture and tannins are enveloped by the rich black fruits and acidity to give a mellifluous wine that will be ready to drink from early 2018.

title: Ribafreixo 2014 Pato Frio Grand Escolha Antão Vaz (Alentejano)
description: After aging in bottle, this wood-aged wine has smoothed out to produce a rich wine with balanced fruit, acidity and toastiness. The wine does have plenty of spice from the wood, but it also has layers of citrus and pear-fruit flavors. Drink this wine now.

title: Mariposa 2014 Tempranillo (Paso Robles)
description: Leather, smoked meat, crushed rock, stewed black cherry and dried oregano notes show on the rustic nose of this bottling from the team at Cru Wine Company. It's light bodied, making for easy quaffing, with red plum, beef jerky and baking spice flavors.

title: Porta 2016 Estate Bottled Reserva Carmenère (Maipo Valley)
description: Meaty berry and black plum aromas fold in a touch of peppercorn. A crisp direct palate is balanced, while spicy black-fruit flavors include a note of burnt toast. Blackened spice is up front on a slightly fiery finish.

title: Produttori Vini Manduria 2016 AKA Primitivo Rosato (Salento)
description: This has intense aromas of chopped sage, mint and Mediterranean scrub. The herbaceous notes carry over to the fresh juicy palate along with Marasca cherry, raspberry and just a whisper of peppercorn.

title: Quasar 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: This Crianza has leathery aromas, a tannic mouthfeel and roasted, spicy red berry flavors. It's dry, oaky and not particularly ripe.

title: Mollydooker 2014 Enchanted Path Shiraz-Cabernet (McLaren Vale)
description: Combine masses of American oak with high ripeness and the result is this warm woody wine oozing with vanilla, molasses and cedar. It's full and plush, but lacks complexity and cellaring potential. Drink it now.

title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Pouca Roupa Branco White (Alentejano)
description: This open, perfumed and fruity wine is crisp and bright. It also has a warm, apricot and ripe pear fruitiness that balances the citrus acidity. It's attractive now and ready to drink.

title: Jardín de Lúculo 2015 Los Bohemios Garnacha (Navarra)
description: This wine's suntan lotion aromas and mild volatility are a bit disconcerting. On the palate, it's full and dark, with abrasive, rubbery tannins and jammy currant and black cherry flavors that finish strong.

title: Joseph Cattin 2016 Riesling (Alsace)
description: A slightly earthy note colors the apple and lemon aromas on the nose. The palate shows lots of freshness and has a tart, light and dry body. The finish is lemony and fresh. Drink while aromas are expressive.

title: Domaine Mersiol 2015 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: A touch of earthy peach appears on the nose. The palate repeats that earthy peach theme and adds some lemon freshness. This is aromatic, off dry and should be drunk while flavors are at their peak.

title: Domaine Sauvat 2014 Nymphéa Prestige Pinot Noir (Puy de Dôme)
description: This is a cool Pinot Noir with flavors both of red fruits and the wood aging. It is smooth with red-cherry fruit and gentle tannins and acidity. The wine, from vineyards on the slopes of Puy de Dôme mountains, is ripe and ready to drink.

title: Indomita 2015 Zardoz Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère (Maipo Valley)
description: Although this smells raw, woody and even a bit citric, sometimes a red wine that's not over the top is in order, and this Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère blend fits that bill. A tight lean racy palate offers flavors of red citric fruits, oak and herbs. Barrel spice is dominant on a tight energetic finish.

title: Leyda 2015 Lot 5 Chardonnay (Leyda Valley)
description: Aromas of starched sheets and lanolin show a hint of apple. This feels rather lean and similar to soda: there isn't much body to it. Tropical melony flavors are oaky, and the finish turns downright woody and sweet like canned pineapple.

title: Murray 2014 Syrah (Red Mountain)
description: This wine shows a bit of oxidation, along with aromas of orange peel, smoked meat and mountain blueberries. The flavors are medium bodied, providing some textural appeal but not entirely coming together.

title: Seven Angels 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)
description: This nose of this wine shy at first, before blackberry paste, hibiscus and cola aromas arise. It's medium-bodied on the palate, with bright blueberry, marjoram and black pepper flavors, bound together by prominent acidity.

title: Torres 2013 Milmanda Chardonnay (Conca de Barberà)
description: On the nose, this aging Chardonnay brings corn to mind. Its palate is neither exciting nor flawed, with melon and stone fruit flavors that are yeasty and short, finishing on a bready and slightly oxidized note. Not a great value for its price.

title: Tenuta di Angoris 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: Ripe and juicy, this offers aromas of pressed spring flower and yellow stone fruit. On the bright palate, a note of candied nectarine zest accents ripe yellow apple and dried apricot.

title: Falua 2016 Conde Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Branco White (Tejo)
description: This soft wine, a blend of Arinto and Fernão Pires, is right in the creamy textured style of white wine. With its flavors of apple and ripe Bartlett pear, the wine is smooth while also crisply refreshing at the end. Drink now.

title: Domaine du Claouset 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: Crisp, tight and full of fruit, this is a lively apéritif style of wine from Vignobles Siozard. A tangy texture gives the wine great lift and adds to its drinkability. Drink now.

title: Finca Villacreces 2014 Pruno  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Earthy but basic berry and plum flavors introduce this bumpy, rugged Tempranillo. Its tight mouthfeel is governed by rough tannins and tomato-like acidity, its lightly herbal, salty plum and berry flavors finishing choppy, rugged and abrasive.

title: Girasole 2015 Sangiovese (Mendocino County)
description: A buttery note tops the vivid cherry and blackberry flavors in this dry, straightforward, no-nonsense wine. Its fruitiness makes it attractive and fun to sip, while fine tannins and good acidity keep it appetizing.

title: Goodfellow 2015 Clover Reserve Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: Tightly wound, with strong phenolic skin highlights, this shows apple and pear skin flavors, with a slightly oxidized character. Despite its youth, this wine is ready to drink now and should be consumed in the coming year.

title: Gotsa Family Wines 2015 Dry Unfiltered Saperavi Rosé (Kartli)
description: Cherry-red in color, this rosé features aromas of cherry and white chocolate. It is surprisingly soft on the palate, with flavors of cherry, peach and citrus. Slightly chewy tannins make their presence known on a finish inflected with flavors of cranberry, thyme and sage.

title: Château Penin 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This is a dry wine, with hints of yeast as well as spice and nutmeg flavors. The fruit is well integrated into this mix of flavors, giving a ripe wine that is ready to drink.

title: Château Sainte Marie 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: Balanced and crisply fruity, this refreshing wine has lively acidity and a tangy texture that brings out minerality. Drink now.
